title: RAGE AGAINST THE MACHINE - Evil Empire [FLAC] 1996
description:
The Evil Empire ÃƒÆ’Ã†â€™Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¢ÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¯Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¿Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â½ÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¯Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¿Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â½ the album of group Rage Against the the Machine given 15 April 1996 year (zob. 1996 in music), almost 4 years after extradition the debut plate. In 1996 be found on # 1 place on Billboard's Top 200.


The album's title is taken from the phrase evil empire, which was used by former U.S. President Ronald Reagan and many Western conservatives in describing the former Soviet Union.

The track "Bulls on Parade" became the first single and, as with their debut, five singles were released in total.

The song "Tire Me" won the 1996 Grammy award for Best Metal Performance. The tracks "Bulls on Parade" and "People of the Sun" were both nominated for Grammy's for Best Hard Rock Performance in separate years.

A Picture of the Album Cover as a Poster can be seen in the Movie Chasing Amy.
